    • Method Detail

      • chordsFromStdNames

        public static ChordProgression chordsFromStdNames(String inputString)
                                           throws UnknownChordException
        Create a Chord sequence based on fake book style chord names. Measures are delimited by the character |. The meter is 4/4. List<Chord> progression = ChordProgressionParser.chordsFromStdNames("F7 | Bb7 | F7 | Cm7 F7 | Bb7 | Bm7 E7 | F7 E7 | Eb7 D7 | Gm7 | C7 Bb7 | Am7 D7 | Gm7 C7");
        Parameters:
        inputString - a chord progression
        Returns:
        a ChordProgression
        Throws:
        UnknownChordException - if any chord is not registered

      • chordsFromStdNames

      • isRoman

        public static boolean isRoman(String input)
        Checks first chord to determine if the progression uses roman numerals. That means you cannot mix roman and standard input.
        Parameters:
        input - a string with the progression
        Returns:
        true if the input is in Roman numerals.
